description: This Sticky Apple Cider Chicken is a delightful fall dish that combines the sweetness of apple cider with savory chicken, creating a mouthwatering experience. Perfect for cozy dinners, this recipe will warm your heart and home.
instructions: In a large oven-safe skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat.
Season the chicken thighs with salt and pepper, then add them to the skillet, skin-side down.
Sear the chicken for about 5-7 minutes until the skin is golden brown.
Flip the chicken and add apple cider and Dijon mustard to the skillet.
Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.
Remove from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving, garnished with fresh thyme.
tips: For the best flavor, use high-quality apple cider and let the chicken marinate in the cider mixture for a few hours before cooking.

Preparation:
Start by preheating your oven and seasoning the chicken. Ensure the chicken is at room temperature before cooking for even results.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Follow the steps to sear the chicken, add the cider mixture, and bake until perfectly cooked. Keep an eye on the chicken to avoid overcooking.
Finishing Touches:
Let the chicken rest before serving to keep it juicy, and garnish with fresh thyme for a pop of color.

For an extra kick, consider adding a splash of apple cider vinegar or a pinch of red pepper flakes to the cider mixture. You can also experiment with different herbs like rosemary or sage for a unique twist.
This Sticky Apple Cider Chicken pairs beautifully with roasted vegetables, mashed potatoes, or a fresh green salad. A glass of crisp white wine or apple cider makes for a perfect accompaniment.
For a gluten-free option, ensure your Dijon mustard is gluten-free. You can also substitute chicken thighs with bone-in chicken breasts, adjusting the cooking time accordingly.
